CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 10, 1951, pg. 3 reads: " Discuss Strategy - Franklin Dudley of 971 Rivermont Drive, one of twenty-seven Negro cab drivers who filed an anti-discrimination suit against the Yellow Cab Company and Taxicab Local 128 in Federal Court, discusses strategy with his attorney, Hymen Schlesinger, during a recess in hearing before Federal Judge Rabe F. Marsh Jr. Tuesday. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Cab driver Franklin Dudley discussing anti-discrimination suit against the Yellow Cab Company and Taxicab Local 128 with Atty. Hymen Schlesinger, in Federal Courthouse
